iti43:1.1: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
iti43:2.1: “There is, mendicants, freedom from rebirth, freedom from what has been produced, made, and conditioned.
iti43:2.2: If there were no freedom from rebirth, freedom from what has been produced, made, and conditioned, then you would find no escape here from rebirth, from what has been produced, made, and conditioned.
iti43:2.3: But since there is freedom from rebirth, freedom from what has been produced, made, and conditioned, an escape is found from rebirth, from what has been produced, made, and conditioned.”
iti43:3.3: wrapped in old age and death,
iti43:4.1: generated by food and the conduit to rebirth:
iti43:4.2: that’s not fit to delight in.
iti43:4.3: The escape from that is peaceful,
iti43:4.4: beyond the scope of logic, everlasting,
iti43:5.1: where nothing is reborn or arisen,
iti43:5.3: the cessation of all painful things,
iti43:6.1: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
